reviews.review:
I like just about anything related to the Team Fortress series, and this game is no exception. The fact that there are people that still play this after all these years is kinda beautiful really. It's a lot more fast-paced and can be way more hectic than that of TF2, and sometimes the balancing of the game can be questionable, but it's still fun none the less.

In other words, I guess you can say that this game is a real...

Although there aren't so many players to be found in a huge list of servers, they do usually gather in a 2fort map so it still has some play in 2019. Besides, it's quite fun too! The classes and the weapons, which are obviously similar to team fortress 2 classes, are where each one of them are unique. If you play team fortress 2, then this title would be highly recommended.

The Classic

If you like TF2, and you've dabbled with the Half-Life 1 engine (via Sven Co-Op or the other Valve games running on this engine, like Half-Life 1 itself), then is is for you.

I like this game, but the only problem is that it doesn't have that Team Fortress-y feel to it, but it's TFC, not TF2, so that's to be expected.

But that's the ONLY problem (for me, at least). 

It's absolutely perfect! If you have enough money, you should absolutely go for this game. It's cheap, too, so you won't have to spend too much to get it.

if this were not exist,

Team Fortress Classic is the forgotten child of Team Fortress 2, or merely the forgotten mother or father. This game is the mod from Half Life (1998). It is very old, but great in some retrospect. The characters seen here, with the same voices are just seen as the "template" of the next era of the game.

Anyway, playing this game is like visiting the lost ruins of Chernobyl. No one plays this shit no more, it is sad.

Sony Pictures' virtual reality division, along with game developer Tequila Works, are developing a sequel to the film via way of a virtual reality video game, Groundhog Day: Like Father Like Son to be released on the PlayStation VR, Oculus Rift, and HTC Vive headsets. The game has the player take the role of Phil's son, Phil Connors, Jr., who similarly becomes trapped in a time loop while in Punxsutawney and requires the player to figure out how to escape it. The game was announced on Groundhog Day, 2019 and is expected to be released in late 2019.[87][88]

TFC is one of those games I'll throw on whenever I acquire an old computer from the car boot or something. No idea why, but it's always compelling to play it on old hardware. The game itself is your bog standard goldsrc affair, same movement system and all that. Most people have been put off trying TFC due to STAR_'s ancient video about it, which essentially boiled down to "It's old and I don't like it". If you haven't tried it, it goes for pennies on sale, or you can always nab the Valve Complete Pack for no money at all via key sites. It's still a joy to play, despite the fact that I prefer its sequel.

DATA WYDANIA:
1 kwietnia 1999 

ta gra to istny żart :)

Average game with very low player base = Not worth money whatsoever. I wouldn't recommend this to those who are collecting Valve games, I wouldn't recommend it to TF2 fans, nor would I recommend it to any audience in general. Very few people actually play this game, and the few who do are either toxic or not even remotely fair or fun to fight against. Playing a game with a large player base with people who will kick your ass is allot different than playing a game with a low player base with people that will kick your ass, because one is actually fun unlike the other. I'd say skip this title at all costs. It has no single player experience either, so just skip it.
